definition: guqin or seven-stringed zither
seven/7
bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: The broken strings of Vina sing no more your praise.
sentences.chinese: 七弦琴的断线不再弹唱赞美你的诗歌。

sentences.english: Lyres were played by the ancient Greeks.
The poetry was chanted to the accompaniment of the lyre.
sentences.chinese: 诗歌吟唱时是用七弦琴伴奏的。

sentences.english: The broken strings of Vina sing no more your praise.
sentences.chinese: 七弦琴的断弦不再弹唱你的荣耀。

sentences.english: As the argument went on, Hermes began to play his lyre.
sentences.chinese: 争论在持续，赫密士开始玩弄他的七弦琴。

sentences.english: Seven-string guitars have an extra low string which is a B in standard tuning.
sentences.chinese: 七弦琴有一根特低弦，在标准调弦里是B音。

sentences.english: Or waked to ecstasy the living lyre.
sentences.chinese: 或拨响令人心醉神迷的七弦琴。

definition: pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
harp
konghou (Chinese harp)
guqin or qin, a long zither with seven strings, plucked with the fingers
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
see 簫|箫[xiao1]
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
huqin/family of Chinese two-stringed fiddles, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and bamboo bow with horsehair bowstring
musical instrument/CL:件[jian4]
string (of a stringed instrument)
bamboo flute/CL:管[guan3]
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
plucked string instrument/CL:件[jian4]
plucked string or stringed instrument/plucked instrument
to play (wind instruments)
